de.mrapp.android.dialog

Class MaterialDialog.Builder

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.mrapp.android.dialog.MaterialDialog.Builder
  • Enclosing class:
    MaterialDialog

    public static class MaterialDialog.Builder
extends java.lang.Object
    A builder, which allows to create and show dialogs, which are designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices. Such a dialog consists of a title, a message and up to three buttons. Furthermore, the dialog can be used to show list items. It is possible to customize the color of the dialog's title and button texts and the title as well as the dialog's content can be replaced with a custom view.

    • Constructor Summary

      Creates a new builder, which allows to create dialogs, which are designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices.

      • Builder

        public Builder(android.content.Context context)
        Creates a new builder, which allows to create dialogs, which are designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the builder, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null

      • Builder

        public Builder(android.content.Context context,
               @StyleRes
               int themeResourceId)
        Creates a new builder, which allows to create dialogs, which are designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be used by the builder, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null
        themeResourceId - The resource id of the theme, which should be used by the dialog, as an Integer value. The resource id must correspond to a valid theme

      • setSingleChoiceItems

        public final MaterialDialog.Builder setSingleChoiceItems(java.lang.CharSequence[] items,
                                                         int checkedItem,
                                                         android.content.DialogInterface.OnClickListener listener)
        Sets the selectable items, which should be shown by the dialog, which is created by the builder. Only one of the items can be selected at once.
        Parameters:
        items - The items, which should be set, as an array of the type CharSequence. The items may not be null
        checkedItem - The index of the item, which should be selected by default, as an Integer value or -1, if no item should be selected by default
        listener - The listener, which should be notified, when an item is clicked, as an instance of the type OnClickListener or null, if no listener should be notified
        Returns:
        The builder, the method has been called upon, as an instance of the class MaterialDialog.Builder

        checkedItem - The index of the item, which should be selected by default, as an Integer value or -1, if no item should be selected by default
        listener - The listener, which should be notified, when an item is clicked, as an instance of the type OnClickListener or null, if no listener should be notified

      • setMultiChoiceItems

        public final MaterialDialog.Builder setMultiChoiceItems(java.lang.CharSequence[] items,
                                                        boolean[] checkedItems,
                                                        android.content.DialogInterface.OnMultiChoiceClickListener listener)
        Sets the selectable items, which should be shown by the dialog, which is created by the builder. Multiple items can be selected at once.
        Parameters:
        items - The items, which should be set, as an array of the type CharSequence. The items may not be null
        checkedItems - An array, which contains, whether the items, which correspond to the corresponding indices, should be selected by default, or not, as a Boolean array or null, if no items should be selected by default
        listener - The listener, which should be notified, when an item is clicked, as an instance of the type OnClickListener or null, if no listener should be notified
        Returns:
        The builder, the method has been called upon, as an instance of the class MaterialDialog.Builder

      • setMultiChoiceItems

        public final MaterialDialog.Builder setMultiChoiceItems(int resourceId,
                                                        boolean[] checkedItems,
                                                        android.content.DialogInterface.OnMultiChoiceClickListener listener)
        Sets the selectable items, which should be shown by the dialog, which is created by the builder. Multiple items can be selected at once.
        Parameters:
        resourceId - The resource id of the items, which should be set, as an Integer value. The resource id must correspond to a valid array resource
        checkedItems - An array, which contains, whether the items, which correspond to the corresponding indices, should be selected by default, or not, as a Boolean array or null, if no items should be selected by default
        listener - The listener, which should be notified, when an item is clicked, as an instance of the type OnClickListener or null, if no listener should be notified
        Returns:
        The builder, the method has been called upon, as an instance of the class MaterialDialog.Builder

      • create

        public final MaterialDialog create()
        Creates a dialog with the arguments, which have been suppplied to the builder. Calling this method does not display the dialog.
        Returns:
        The dialog, which has been create as an instance of the class MaterialDialog

      • show

        public final MaterialDialog show()
        Creates a dialog with the arguments, which have been supplied to the builder and immediately displays it.
        Returns:
        The dialog, which has been shown, as an instance of the class MaterialDialog
